title.narrative: OUPUT 1.3. ENABLING ENVIRONMENT HEALTH

description.narrative: By end 2021, national, provincial and local authorities have the knowledge and capacity to commit to improving the legislative, regulatory, social and judicial frameworks and strategic and operational planning for health, which contributes to Child Health, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Health And Emergencies, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Maternal And Newborn Health, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Polio Eradication, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1. By the end of 2022, adolescents, pregnant and lactating women, mothers and children 0-5 years of age are using more quality health services in the 10 targeted provinces.

title.narrative: By end 2021, national, provincial and local authorities have the knowledge and capacity to commit to improving the legislative,regulatory, social and judicial frameworks and strategic and operational planning for health

description.narrative: The COVID-19 national deployment vaccination plan (NDVP) was supported in the areas of coordination, cold chain and logistics as well as communication resulting in 95,267 persons fully vaccinated (0.55% of the total population or 1.1% of the target of the NDVP) from 4 June to 31 December. The community health strategy was revised, and the preparation and implementation of community health activities completed in one additional district. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:24/01/2022
